newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Coxsackie virus claims 24th victim - paper.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Coxsackie virus claims 24th victim - paper.

text.p: A six-month-old girl became the 24th victim of a deadly strain of the Coxsackie B virus in the eastern Malaysian state of Sarawak, The Star newspaper said on Friday.

A total of 136 infants were still in hospital with the infection, with three in a serious condition, Health Minister Chua Jui Meng was quoted as saying. He was speaking to reporters after visiting an isolation ward in a hospital in state capital Kuching.
Experts from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta are already in Malaysia trying to ascertain the nature of the infection, which started in April.
The virus has also struck the towns of Sibu and Sarikei, also in Sarawak state.
The virus which can be carried by air, was originally found in infected food, health officials said earlier. Symptoms include fever, nervous fits, paralysis and finally heart failure.
